Description: Papyrus. Demotic account. The papyrus is torn at both top and bottom and on both sides. On the recto there are 15 lines of text recording quantities of produce and unidentified amounts (of money?), interspersed occasionally with the names of individuals. On the verso there are the traces of the ends of seven lines of numbers.
Curator's comments: On the recto, line 7, the place name Tanis, although slightly damaged (the T3 is rubbed), can be recognised. This would be Tanis in the Fayyum, which is located in the Meris of Herakleides.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380992) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380992)
